intro: Chelidonium majus subsp. asiaticum, commonly known as Asian greater celandine, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its yellow, papery flowers and smooth, often waxy leaves. The plant contains alkaloids such as chelidonine, which have been studied for their medicinal properties. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
